result.execSummary:
All charges against Alison Mae Kastens in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alison Mae Kastens is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Filed by DE. with attached jail records. arc   Per SRN, Reviewed.  c: DA, DF Atty arc

11:55 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alison Mae Kastens in court, in custody.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin for Atty Joel Larimore in court for Alison Mae Kastens. Includes 21CF364, 21CF702, 21CF704, 21CF825, 21CF878, & 22CF347.  ADA Ellenwood recites joint agreement and informs the  court DE has provided proof of inpatient treatment facility. Court authorizes Atty Perrin to assist for today's hearings.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads G to Ct 2- Neglecting a Child & Ct 3- Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 21CF364 and G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping Felony in 21CF702.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 & 3 in 21CF364 and Ct 1 in 21CF702.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 21CF364, 21CF704, 21CF825, 21CF878, & 22CF347. Court waives PSI. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 21CF364

S/W 3 Years Probation

Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00      
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Apply bond on file (21CF825 & 878), balance to be paid through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Complete program of treatment at facility
- Follow through any recommended treatment by agent
- Test Randomly and regularly 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Take appropriate parenting classes relative to ability to reengage with sons life 
- DE to be transported directly from jail to facility with no stops in between
- DE to sign up for probation before leave for treatment

Court reserves on credit, Attorneys to file total credit by 4:30 PM on Wednesday 8/3/22

Court Orders: Ct 3 in 21CF364
S/W 3 Years Probation

Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $243.00      
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00
Apply bond on file (21CF825 & 878), balance to be paid through probation

Conditions of probation to mirror Count 2 in 21CF364

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 21CF702
S/W 3 Years Probation

Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 

- Court Costs: $268.00      
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
Apply bond on file (21CF825 & 878), balance to be paid through probation

Conditions of probation to mirror Count 2 in 21CF364
for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Filed by DE. arc    PER RMW, DENIED. arc

8:42 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: B Harris, Defendant Alison Mae Kastens in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Alison Mae Kastens.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CF364, 21CF702, 21CF704, 21CF825, 21CF878, & 22CF347.  Court reviews files, ARGN on 22CF347- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond modification request on 22CF347.  Atty Larimore makes statements.  ADA Ellenwood makes argument regarding bond. Court denies motion to modify bond, if DE does have treatment and it is lined up Court may modify bond at that time. Atty Larimore states he believes these cases are resolved but requesting more time for DE to complete treatment.  Atty Larimore believes the driving cases are 21CF364 & 21CF702- Branch III.  This Court has no objection for Branch III hearing these matters.  Adjourned at 8:53 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

c: DE c/o Jail, Jail
e: DA & Atty
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.

3:58 PM  Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Alison Mae Kastens appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: Preliminary Hearing for 22CF347 & STC's for 21CF364, 21CF702, 21CF704, 21CF825, 21CF878.  22CF347:  DF wishes to waive the Preliminary hearing.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues.  Adjourned: 4:05  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.
for Release/ Modification/ Change in Sentence. Filed by DE. arc     to RMW.
Defendant's copy of NOH- STC returned by PO with Unable to forward- Not Deliverable as addressed. arc   DEF in custody. Placed in Jail Mailbox. arc
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kevin R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Candi T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, residence at 310 Main St. Deer Park, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF347 (INIT), 21CF825, 21CF364, 21CF702, 21CF704 & 21CF878 (RW):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito and Travis Satorius   DF:  Alison Mae Kastens appeared from jail via video. Address and DOB confirmed. Qualifies for PD services. Atty Dippolito waives further reading. Atty Larimore is appointed on other files. Court will refer to JA for further scheduling.
